author: Brian Costa
title: Goepper Salvages Silver for U.S. in Ski Slopestyle
text:
BONGPYEONG, South Korea—Four years after the U.S. swept the podium in men’s freeski slopestyle, it settled for only one medalist on Sunday. Nick Goepper, the defending bronze medalist, won silver.
Ostensibly, it was something of a letdown, but in reality the U.S. was lucky that even one of its medal-winning skiers from 2014 made it back to the podium. Joss Christensen, the defending gold medalist, didn’t even qualify for the team after undergoing ACL surgery. Gus Kenworthy, who won silver in Sochi, broke his thumb Thursday,...
